alert.note: Alert for Copiah; Simpson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 12 at 4:23PM CDT until March 12 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Simpson County in central Mississippi... Northeastern Copiah County in central Mississippi... * Until 515 PM CDT. * At 423 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hopewell, or near Crystal Springs, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Union and Harrisville around 435 PM CDT. Pinola around 445 PM CDT. Mendenhall around 450 PM CDT. Sanatorium around 455 PM CDT. Magee and Martinville around 500 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include D`Lo and Georgetown. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
